org.waarp.icap

Class IcapClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waarp.icap.IcapClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class IcapClient
extends Object
implements Closeable
    The IcapClient allows to do 3 actions:
    • connect(): which allows to initialize the connection with the ICAP server
    • close(): forces the client to disconnect from the ICAP server
    • scanFile(path): send a file for a scan by the ICAP server

    This code is inspired from 2 sources:
    • https://github.com/Baekalfen/ICAP-avscan
    • https://github.com/claudineyns/icap-client

    This reflects the RFC 3507 and errata as of 2010/04/17.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IcapClient

        public IcapClient(String serverIP,
                  int port,
                  String icapService)
        This creates the ICAP client without connecting immediately to the ICAP server. When the ICAP client will connect, it will ask for the preview size to the ICAP Server.
        Parameters:
        serverIP - The IP address to connect to.
        port - The port in the host to use.
        icapService - The service to use (fx "avscan").

      • IcapClient

        public IcapClient(String serverIP,
                  int port,
                  String icapService,
                  int previewSize)
        This creates the ICAP client without connecting immediately to the ICAP server. When the ICAP client will connect, it will not ask for the preview size to the ICAP Server but uses the default specified value.
        Parameters:
        serverIP - The IP address to connect to.
        port - The port in the host to use.
        icapService - The service to use (fx "avscan").
        previewSize - Amount of bytes to send as preview.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public final IcapClient connect()
                         throws IcapException
        Try to connect to the server and if the preview size is not specified, it will also resolve the options of the ICAP server.
        If the client is still connected, it will first disconnect before reconnecting to the ICAP Server.
        Note that every attempts of connection will retry to issue an OPTIONS request if necessary (if preview size is not set to a fixed value already).
        Throws:
        IcapException - if an issue occurs during the connection or response (the connection is already closed)

      • close

        public final void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • scanFile

        public final boolean scanFile(String filename)
                       throws IcapException
        Given a file path, it will send the file to the server and return true, if the server accepts the file. Visa-versa, false if the server rejects it.
        Note that if the client is not connected, it will first call connect().
        Parameters:
        filename - Relative or absolute file path to a file. If filename is EICARTEST, then a build on the fly EICAR test file is sent.
        Returns:
        Returns true when no infection is found.
        Throws:
        IcapException - if an error occurs (network, file reading, bad headers)
